      • calculateAirDistanceBetweenCoordinates

        public static double calculateAirDistanceBetweenCoordinates(SKCoordinate pointA,
                                            SKCoordinate pointB)
        Returns the distance between the two given spheric coordinates, SKCoordinate pointA and SKCoordinate pointB. The distance will be delivered in meter considering that the earth is a sphere with a predefined radius.

        The distance is calculated according to the spheric trigonometry. The accuracy of the distance is about 200 to 250 ppm if the distance is less than 200 km. This is a maximum of 2,5 meter failure in 1 km.

        Parameters:
        pointA - first point
        pointB - second point
        Returns:
        distance on surface in meter

      • calculateAirDistanceBetweenCoordinates

        public static double calculateAirDistanceBetweenCoordinates(double pointALong,
                                            double pointALat,
                                            double pointBLong,
                                            double pointBLat)
        Returns the distance between the two given spheric coordinate pairs (point_A_long, point_A_lat) and (point_B_long, point_B_lat). The distance will be delivered in meter considering that the earth is a sphere with a predefined radius.

        The distance is calculated according to the spheric trigonometry. The accuracy of the distance is about 200 to 250 ppm if the distance is less than 200 km. This is a maximum of 2,5 meter failure in 1 km.

        Parameters:
        pointALong - longitude of the first point in decimal degree
        pointALat - latitude of the first point in decimal degree
        pointBLong - longitude of the second point in decimal degree
        pointBLat - latitude of the seconds point in decimal degree
        Returns:
        distance on surface in meter
